results.content: Great course for learning MERN stack, MVC and deployment. The instructor, Ryan, explains things thoroughly and answered the one question I had quickly.  This is the second class of his I have taken and have purchased four others. I'm looking forward to learning more from Ryan.
results.content_html: Great course for learning MERN stack, MVC and deployment. The instructor, Ryan, explains things thoroughly and answered the one question I had quickly. This is the second class of his I have taken and have purchased four others. I'm looking forward to learning more from Ryan.

results.content: In his course Ryan uses the word beautiful a lot. And that's exactly what this course is: BEAUTIFUL. I really liked the way everything was explained, very crisp and clear, good pace. The project is awesome and covers a lot of react and node must-know features. And it's responsive. No, it didn't cover Redux or Hooks, but I didn't miss it as there was plenty to enjoy. This course has given me the tools to continue working on real-life react-node projects. Well done Ryan, thanks a lot! I really appreciate your quick and good responses on the two minor doubts I had. Cheers!
results.content_html: In his course Ryan uses the word beautiful a lot. And that's exactly what this course is: BEAUTIFUL. I really liked the way everything was explained, very crisp and clear, good pace. The project is awesome and covers a lot of react and node must-know features. And it's responsive. No, it didn't cover Redux or Hooks, but I didn't miss it as there was plenty to enjoy. This course has given me the tools to continue working on real-life react-node projects. Well done Ryan, thanks a lot! I really appreciate your quick and good responses on the two minor doubts I had. Cheers!

results.content: I really enjoyed going through the whole process and learned a lot of new things in the process. It covers a lot of ground, including the basics of setting up and testing an api, setting up a front end to work with it, authentication and authorization as well as working with MongoDB/mongoose as the db solution.
results.content_html: I really enjoyed going through the whole process and learned a lot of new things in the process. It covers a lot of ground, including the basics of setting up and testing an api, setting up a front end to work with it, authentication and authorization as well as working with MongoDB/mongoose as the db solution.

results.content: I learnt a lot on this course! It was like you were sitting with a personal mentor who was explaining everything at a level that was easy to understand. Ryan explained both the fundamentals of Javascript as well as concrete examples of getting the webapp working in Node.js and React.js. He explained why he was doing each step, not just showing the step. I can definitely recommend this course to others who have a basic knowledge of development.
results.content_html: I learnt a lot on this course! It was like you were sitting with a personal mentor who was explaining everything at a level that was easy to understand. Ryan explained both the fundamentals of Javascript as well as concrete examples of getting the webapp working in Node.js and React.js. He explained why he was doing each step, not just showing the step. I can definitely recommend this course to others who have a basic knowledge of development.

results.content: I went into this course with Full Stack experience using React and Node - however I haven't used Mongo and instead used SQLite - with that said, seeing the process that Ryan takes in building his server is actually very exciting since he goes into a good amount of detail - because let's be honest, if you want more detail - read the docs. So far in the course, Ryan is doing an awesome job with going through the steps on building the app and explaining the process with detail. would give it five stars if he used axios and hooks but unfortunately this course seems a bit outdated.
results.content_html: I went into this course with Full Stack experience using React and Node - however I haven't used Mongo and instead used SQLite - with that said, seeing the process that Ryan takes in building his server is actually very exciting since he goes into a good amount of detail - because let's be honest, if you want more detail - read the docs. So far in the course, Ryan is doing an awesome job with going through the steps on building the app and explaining the process with detail. would give it five stars if he used axios and hooks but unfortunately this course seems a bit outdated.

results.content:
It's not teaching.

It's listening to a guy talk while he codes a bunch of stuff you probably won't understand, while explaining barely any of it. 

He knows what he's doing and I'm sure he's a very skilled programmer, but teaching is another skill entirely.

I suppose the value here lies in the source code, which you can use as a base for any apps you create with login functionality and a dashboard and edit later since his structuring is good.

But, as for learning - I'd had enough around the half way mark. As I said, just him talking and coding with no explanations.

There are also errors in the final code. The final source code feels buggy and has errors galore in the console.
results.content_html:
It's not teaching.

It's listening to a guy talk while he codes a bunch of stuff you probably won't understand, while explaining barely any of it.

He knows what he's doing and I'm sure he's a very skilled programmer, but teaching is another skill entirely.

I suppose the value here lies in the source code, which you can use as a base for any apps you create with login functionality and a dashboard and edit later since his structuring is good.

But, as for learning - I'd had enough around the half way mark. As I said, just him talking and coding with no explanations.

There are also errors in the final code. The final source code feels buggy and has errors galore in the console.

results.content: The audio could be better. It is difficult to hear the speaker at times. However, the content is from a real word dev and has some good professional practices. The video editing is not very professional and Ryan (course presenter) tends to make a lot of typos on his code. He often spells const as conts which is slightly annoying because most of his videos are made at night and he tends to get really tired hense teh typoes ;-0
results.content_html: The audio could be better. It is difficult to hear the speaker at times. However, the content is from a real word dev and has some good professional practices. He often spells const as conts which is slightly annoying because most of his videos are made at night and he tends to get really tired hense teh typoes ;-0

results.content:
great course ..perfect pace and concepts delivery 

This may not be a starting point for a beginner ..underlying basic concepts needs to be learnt prior to this for better clarity  .. but a must do course after clearing the basic concepts about node, react and mango db.

I had started the course and found i was missing few concepts .. then  followed the React basic free course by the same instructor before resuming back.

This course will make you completely capable .

results.content: Great coverage on how to handle middleware, routes, authorization & authentication so far. However, this doesn't really cover any consistent error handling, and doesn't explain best practices as far as how to handle asynchronous errors with next(). Also, authentication with tokens is less secure than authentication with express-session.
results.content_html: Great coverage on how to handle middleware, routes, authorization & authentication so far. However, this doesn't really cover any consistent error handling, and doesn't explain best practices as far as how to handle asynchronous errors with next(). Also, authentication with tokens is less secure than authentication with express-session.

results.content:
- compared to other videos im learning with at this same time-
1) he is explaining what he is doing but just describing what he is doing. I have no idea why or the context. Its literally just description not teaching. 
2) im sorry if this sounds rude and i understand, but his accent is hard for me to follow at times.  
3) the explanaition for why js begs alot of questions. He makes so many assumptions.
